resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete this farm?
You haven\'t selected a pin yet!

Developers:
- Zachary Backmeier
- Kaleb MacArthur

Data Source: Environment and Climate Change Canada
Data Source: Open Street Map

Home menu:
The weather is displayed here. You can see the forecast and the weather/forecasted weather there. you can access the settings menu from the top right button as well.

Settings menu:
Here, you can adjust a few localisation modifications. For example, you can choose your preferred units of measuring temperature, as well as measuring fluids. You can also choose between up to six different farms, which allows you to keep track of multiple farms in which you are tapping. You can long press the farm to clear all the trees. A pop-up menu will alert you before you accidentally delete all of your trees.Lastly, there are links to the credits and help menus.

Management page:
Contains links to the new tree and edit tree pages.

New tree page:
In this interface, you can choose where and how you will place a new tree. You can give it a name to better help you identify it. You can also put the amount of sap you've already collected from it if you are interested. To move it into proper place, move the map around and zoom into where you would like the tree to be placed. Press SAVE when you are done filling out the information.

Edit tree page:
Here, you can use the dropdown menu to select a tree that you would like to edit. You can also tap on trees on the map to select them. Then, you are free to change the trees name, and add in the change of sap. For example, if you collected 10 more litres of sap, you can add in 10L to the tree. This is also where you can delete a tree if needed with the Delete button. And you can save your modifications to your tree there as well.

Statistics page:
All of your trees will be shown here to show you general statistics for all your trees combined, and you can tap a tree to see specific stats for that single tree as well.
Are you sure you want to delete this tree?
